{{Infobox news event | title = Rosario gas explosion | image = [[File:Rosario gas explosion - location map.png|250px]] | caption = Location map | date = {{start date|2013|08|06}} | time = 9:30 am | place = [[Rosario, Santa Fe]], [[Argentina]] | coordinates = {{coord|32.9369|S|60.6510|W|display=title,inline}} | also known as = | cause = Gas leak | reported injuries = 60<ref name="Bilotta" /> | reported death(s) = 22<ref name="veintidos">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1627133-fallecio-otra-de-las-personas-heridas-en-la-explosion-de-un-edificio-de-rosario|title= Falleció otra de las personas heridas por la explosión de un edificio de Rosario|trans_title= Another person injured by the explosion of a building in Rosario dies|language= Spanish|date= October 8, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=October 10, 2013}}</ref> }} A [[gas explosion]] in a residential area of [[Rosario, Santa Fe|Rosario]], the third-largest city in [[Argentina]], occurred on August 6, 2013. It was caused by a large gas leak; a nearby building collapsed, and others were at high risk of structural failure. Twenty-two people died, and sixty were injured. Several organizations helped secure the area, search for survivors and aid people who lost their homes. Shortly after the explosion, the time needed for reconstruction was estimated at six months.
The provincial judiciary launched an investigation into the cause of the explosion. Primary suspects were [[Litoral Gas]] (the natural-gas provider for Rosario) and an employee who carried out maintenance work at the building that day. Several public figures sent condolences, and most of the candidates for the [[Argentine legislative election, 2013|2013 primary elections]] suspended their political campaigns.
==The event== The explosion occurred at 9:30 a.m. near the intersection of Oroño and Salta Streets in central [[Rosario, Santa Fe|Rosario]]. Initial reports confirmed eight people dead, sixty injured and fifteen missing; eight more deaths were later confirmed.<ref name="explo">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1607985-explosion-edificio-rosario|title= Fuerte explosión en un edificio de Rosario: asciende a 12 el número de muertos y hay al menos 60 heridos|trans_title= Strong explosion in Rosario: the bodycount rises to 12 and there are at least 60 injuries|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> Searches the following day revealed twelve fatalities, ten of whom were identified.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608306-discrepancias-y-dudas-en-torno-a-la-cantidad-de-muertos-que-dejo-la-explosion-del-edificio-e|title= Discrepancias y dudas en torno a la cantidad de muertos que dejó la explosión del edificio en Rosario|trans_title= Disagreements and doubts about the number of deaths left by the explosion of the building in Rosario|language= Spanish|date= August 7, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> A number of people were missing; some were found dead among the debris, while others were rescued.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608630-a-mas-de-40-horas-de-la-explosion-buscan-a-11-desaparecidos-en-rosario|title= A más de 40 horas de la explosión, buscan a 11 desaparecidos en Rosario|trans_title= More than 40 hours after the explosion, 11 disappeared people are still being searched for|language= Spanish|author= Valeria Musse|date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> The search for survivors ended on August 13, with twenty-two people confirmed dead.<ref name="veintiuno">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1610126-hallan-tres-cuerpos-mas-y-asciende-a-21-el-numero-de-victimas-en-rosario|title= Hallan tres cuerpos más y asciende a 21 el número de víctimas en Rosario|trans_title= Three more bodies are found, and the bodycount in Rosario rises to 21|language= Spanish|author= José Bordón|date= August 13, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 11, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/sociedad/explosion-reanudan-busqueda-desaparecidos_0_973102966.html|title= Encontraron dos cuerpos más y son 21 los muertos por la explosión|trans_title= Two more bodies were found, the deaths of the explosion are 32|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 12, 2013|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=January 30, 2014}}</ref> A 65-year-old woman who had been injured died on October 8.<ref name="veintidos"/><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/sociedad/Tragedia-Rosario-muertos-explosion_0_1007899257.html|title= Tragedia de Rosario: son 22 los muertos por la explosión|trans_title= Tragedy in Rosario: the deaths of the explosion are 22|language= Spanish|author= Mauro Aguilar|date= October 9, 2013|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=January 25, 2014}}</ref>
The explosion was caused by a gas leak in a 30-year-old building. It severely damaged a nearby nine-story apartment building, causing it to collapse.<ref name="explo"/> [[Mónica Fein]], mayor of Rosario, asked residents to avoid the area because of the risk that more buildings might collapse, and to ease the work of disaster management personnel. The streets were covered with broken glass from damaged buildings.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1607987-las-calles-estan-repletas-de-vidrio-dijo-una-vecina-del-edificio|title= 'Las calles están repletas de vidrio', dijo una vecina del edificio|trans_title= 'The streets are filled of glass', said a neighbor of the building|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 6, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> Gas and electricity were immediately disconnected, and the national government sent an [[Argentine Federal Police]] task force to the scene.<ref name="explo"/>
The natural gas supplier, [[Litoral Gas]], immediately began sealing the distribution pipe to the area.<ref name="norec"/> The Center for Ambulatory Medical Specialties of Rosario ({{lang-es|Centro de Especialidades Médicas Ambulatorias de Rosario}}) managed the information about the dead and injured, and tents were prepared for those left homeless.<ref name="yajus" /> Firefighters and other workers found people trapped on the upper floors of buildings and evacuated them over adjacent roofs.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608023-el-angustiante-rescate-de-los-afectados-por-la-explosion-en-rosario|title= El angustiante rescate de los afectados por la explosión en Rosario|trans_title= The sad rescue of the victims of the explosions in Rosario|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 15, 2013}}</ref> Although the building was not destroyed by the explosion, a high risk of [[Structural integrity and failure|structural failure]] remained.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608024-un-escape-de-gas-la-causa-del-estallido-ocurrido-en-rosario|title= Un escape de gas, la causa del estallido ocurrido en Rosario|trans_title= A gas leak, the reason of the explosion in Rosario|language= Spanish|author= Juan R. Mascardi|date= August 6, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 15, 2013}}</ref>
=={{anchor|Investigations}}Investigation== Neighbors reported to the press that they had smelled a gas leak several hours before the explosion and had called Litoral Gas. Company director José María González said that the company had received no such calls, and thought that callers might have dialed the 911 emergency number instead.<ref name="norec">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608004-litoral-gas-dice-que-no-tuvieron-reclamos-en-el-call-center|title= Litoral Gas dice que no tuvieron reclamos en el call center|trans_title= Litoral Gas says they had no requests in the call center|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> Prosecutor Camporini reported at the trial that the building had experienced several gas leaks before the explosion.<ref name="imputado">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608598-el-gasista-fue-imputado-por-estrago-culposo-y-esta-muy-comprometido|title= El gasista fue imputado por estrago culposo y está muy comprometido|trans_title= The gas employee was accused and he's very complicated|language= Spanish|author= José Bordón|date= October 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref>
The provincial judiciary launched an investigation into the circumstances surrounding the explosion.<ref name="yajus">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608062-la-justicia-de-santa-fe-ya-investiga-las-causas-de-la-explosion|title= La Justicia de Santa Fe ya investiga las causas de la explosión|trans_title= The Santa Fe judiciary is already investigating the causes of the explosion|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> The prosecution conducted a [[search and seizure]] at the offices of Litoral Gas to confirm the absence of customer complaints about the gas leak.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608095-allanan-las-oficinas-de-litoral-gas-en-rosario|title= La Fiscalía allanó las oficinas de Litoral Gas en Rosario|trans_title= The prosecution seized the offices of Litoral Gas in Rosario|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> Judge [[Juan Carlos Curto]] ordered the arrest of Carlos Osvaldo García, an employee of the department responsible for gas service to the area.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608131-ordenan-la-detencion-del-gasista-que-trabajaba-en-el-edificio|title= Ordenan la detención del gasista que trabajaba en el edificio|trans_title=Detention of the gas employee who worked in the apartment building ordered|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> He was captured during the night,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608171-detuvieron-al-gasista-que-trabajaba-en-el-edificio-que-exploto|title= Detuvieron al gasista que trabajaba en el edificio que explotó|trans_title= The gas employee who worked at the exploded building has been detained|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> and his assistant Pablo Miño surrendered to police the following day.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608219-detuvieron-a-dos-gasistas-y-allanaron-litoral-gas|title= Detuvieron a dos gasistas y allanaron Litoral Gas|trans_title= Two gas employees were detained, and Litoral Gas was seized|language= Spanish|date= August 7, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> According to witnesses, one employee fled in a van before the explosion, when he realized the severity of the gas leak, while another remained to try to evacuate people from the endangered area.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608407-uno-de-los-detenidos-huyo-cuando-vio-la-magnitud-del-escape-de-gas|title= Uno de los detenidos habría huido cuando vio la magnitud del escape de gas|trans_title= One of the detained employees may have escaped when he saw the severity of the gas leak|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 7, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> The van belonged to García,<ref name="imputado" /> who experienced an [[acute stress reaction]] during the trial.<ref name="imputado" /> Curto checked the remnants of the gas employee's workshop to verify García's testimony.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608728-un-juez-recorrio-el-edificio-de-la-explosion-para-corroborar-los-dichos-del-gasista|title= Un juez recorrió el edificio de la explosión para 'corroborar' los dichos del gasista|trans_title= A judge visited the building of the explosion to 'check' the sayings of the gas employee|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 24, 2013}}</ref><ref name="cruces">{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/sociedad/Siguen-cruces-empresa-actor-principal_0_971302941.html|title= Siguen los cruces: para el juez, la empresa 'es un actor principal'|trans_title= The discussions continue: for the judge, the firm 'is a main actor'|language= Spanish|author= Lucas Aranda|date= August 9, 2013|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=January 30, 2014}}</ref>
Prosecutor Graciela Argüelles said that, according to the investigation, Litoral Gas ignored calls for help from García, who was not properly trained to manage such a situation. The judge suggested that documents seized from Litoral Gas might prove the existence of customer reports of a gas leak.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608841-litoral-gas-mas-comprometida-por-la-explosion-en-rosario|title= Litoral Gas, más comprometida por la explosión en Rosario|trans_title= Litoral Gas, more complicated by the explosion in Rosario|language= Spanish|author= José Bordón|date= August 9, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref> Curto thought that the employees might not bear sole responsibility, and that the liability of Litoral Gas had to be investigated as well.<ref name="cruces"/>
Pablo Miño was released from prison, but Curto refused to release García, saying that Miño had [[extenuating circumstances]] which García did not.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1609061-explosion-en-rosario-liberan-al-ayudante-del-gasista|title= Explosión en Rosario: niegan la excarcelación del gasista y liberaron al ayudante|trans_title= Explosion in Rosario: release is refused to the gas employee, but granted to his assistant|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 9, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref> Miño's job was to give García the required tools, not to do the maintenance. He was in the street, watching over the van, which was not properly parked and locked, and did not see García's work before the explosion. Curto stopped short of pronouncing Miño innocent at that early stage.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1609288-el-gasista-seguira-detenido-y-citan-a-declarar-a-los-directivos-de-la-empresa-litoral-gas|title= El gasista seguirá detenido y citan a declarar a los directivos de la empresa Litoral Gas|trans_title= The gas employee will stay under detention and the heads of Litoral Gas will be prosecuted|language= Spanish|author= José Bordón|date= August 10, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref>
As the case expanded beyond his jurisdiction, Curto [[Judicial disqualification|recused]] himself from the trial and was replaced by [[Javier Beltramone]],<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1611116-la-tragedia-de-rosario-se-quedo-sin-juez|title= La tragedia de Rosario se quedó sin juez|trans_title= The tragedy in Rosario is left without a judge|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 16, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref> who released García from prison.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1611717-explosion-en-rosario-liberaron-al-gasista|title= Explosión en Rosario: el juez ordenó la liberación del gasista|trans_title= Explosion in Rosario: the judge ordered the liberation of the gas employee|language= Spanish|author= José Bordón|date= August 17, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref> Litoral Gas demanded Beltramone's recusal for expressing an opinion about the case to the press.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/sociedad/Apartan-juez-investigaba-tragedia-Rosario_0_1008499637.html|title= Apartan al juez que investigaba la tragedia de Rosario|trans_title= The judge investigating the tragedy in Rosario is demoted|language= Spanish|author= Andrés Actis|date= October 10, 2013|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=January 30, 2014}}</ref> The appeal court agreed in a 2–1 vote to remove Beltramone, and the case was transferred to [[Patricia Bilotta]].<ref name="Bilotta">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1627802-separan-al-juez-que-estaba-a-cargo-de-la-investigacion-de-la-explosion-en-rosario|title= Separan al juez que estaba a cargo de la investigación de la explosión en Rosario|trans_title= The judge who was dealing with the investigation of the explosion in Rosario has been removed|language= Spanish|author= José Bordón|date= October 10, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref> García had claimed that he was following instructions received in the days before the explosion, so Bilotta summoned the technical officers of Litoral Gas to clarify that point.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lacapital.com.ar/la-ciudad/Salta-2141-Quieren-establecer-si-el-gasista-notifico-a-Litoral-Gas--20131126-0031.html|title= Salta 2141: Quieren establecer si el gasista notificó a Litoral Gas|trans_title= Salta 2141: they want to establish if the gas employee notified Litoral Gas|language= Spanish|author= |date= November 26, 2013|publisher= La Capital|accessdate=February 2, 2014}}</ref> Litoral Gas said that García had not received any instructions prior to the explosion.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lacapital.com.ar/la-ciudad/Litoral-Gas-dijo-que-el-gasista-no-pidio-permiso-para-proceder-20131127-0032.html|title= Litoral Gas dijo que el gasista no pidió permiso para proceder|trans_title= Litoral Gas said that the gas employee did not ask for permission to proceed|language= Spanish|author= |date= November 27, 2013|publisher= La Capital|accessdate=February 2, 2014}}</ref>
Litoral Gas proposed an [[out-of-court settlement]] to the relatives of the victims, offering about 1200 US dollars per square meter of collapsed building, in addition to compensation for loss of life.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lacapital.com.ar/la-ciudad/Ahora-Litoral-Gas-les-propone-un-arreglo-economico-a-las-victimas-de-Salta-2141-20131129-0041.html|title= Ahora Litoral Gas les propone un arreglo económico a las víctimas de Salta 2141|trans_title= Now Litoral Gas proposes an economic agreement to the victims of Salta 2141|language= Spanish|author= |date= November 29, 2013|publisher= La Capital|accessdate=February 2, 2014}}</ref> Vice Governor [[Jorge Henn]] rejected it as immoral,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lacapital.com.ar/la-ciudad/El-vicegobernador-Henn-aseguro-que-lo-de-Litoral-Gas-es-inmoral-e-inescrupuloso-20131130-0029.html|title= El vicegobernador Henn aseguró que 'lo de Litoral Gas es inmoral e inescrupuloso'|trans_title= Vicegovernor Henn swore that 'Litoral Gas' proposal is immoral and unscrupulous'|language= Spanish|author= |date= November 30, 2013|publisher= La Capital|accessdate=February 2, 2014}}</ref> and most of the families also initially rejected the proposal.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lacapital.com.ar/la-ciudad/Familiares-de-victimas-de-Salta-2141-rechazan-un-ofrecimiento-economico-de-Litoral-Gas-20131128-0037.html|title= Familiares de víctimas de Salta 2141 rechazan un ofrecimiento económico de Litoral Gas|trans_title= Relatives of victims of Salta 2141 reject an economic offering from Litoral Gas|language= Spanish|author= |date= November 28, 2013|publisher= La Capital|accessdate=February 2, 2014}}</ref> By May 2014, however, almost half of the families had accepted the settlement.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lacapital.com.ar/la-ciudad/Casi-la-mitad-de-los-afectados-por-la-explosion-en-Salta-2141-arreglo-con-Litoral-Gas-20140528-0023.html|title= Casi la mitad de los afectados por la explosión en Salta 2141 arregló con Litoral Gas|trans_title= Almost half of those affected by the explosion at Salta 2141 dealt with Litoral Gas|language= Spanish|author= Guillermo Zysman|date= May 28, 2014|publisher= La Capital|accessdate=June 10, 2014}}</ref>
=={{anchor|Reactions}}Reaction== [[File:070813-rosario2.jpg|thumb|left|alt=Woman walking through a disaster area with many other people|President [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]] at the site of the explosion]] The explosion occurred shortly before the primary [[Argentine legislative election, 2013|2013 Argentine legislative elections]] on August 11. The governor of Santa Fe province, [[Antonio Bonfatti]], asked the political parties to end their campaigns to allow mourning for the victims of the explosion.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608063-tras-la-explosion-en-rosario-piden-suspender-la-campana-electoral|title= El gobernador de Santa Fe pidió suspender la campaña electoral|trans_title= The governor of Santa Fe asked to suspend the political campaign|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> The [[Front for Victory]] and [[Progressive, Civic and Social Front]] candidates suspended their campaigns,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608140-el-frente-para-la-victoria-dio-por-terminada-su-campana-electoral-en-santa-fe-por-la-tragica|title= El Frente para la Victoria dio por terminada su campaña electoral en Santa Fe por la trágica explosión|trans_title= The Front for Victory considers their political campaign in Santa Fe ended because of the explosion|language= Spanish|date= August 6, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608289-la-tragedia-dejo-en-suspenso-la-campana|title= La tragedia dejó en suspenso la campaña|trans_title= The tragedy suspended the campaign|language= Spanish|date= August 7, 2013|publisher=La Nación|accessdate=September 7, 2013}}</ref> and the national government declared two days of [[National day of mourning|mourning]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608358-el-gobierno-declaro-duelo-de-dos-dias-por-la-explosion-de-rosario|title= El Gobierno declaró duelo de dos días por la explosión de Rosario|trans_title= The government issued a two-days mourning for the explosion in Rosario|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 7, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> The period of mourning was observed by all candidates in Buenos Aires and most other provinces, who ended their political campaigns.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608625-sin-actos-el-final-de-la-campana-quedo-tenido-por-la-tragedia-de-rosario|title= Sin actos, el final de la campaña quedó teñido por la tragedia de Rosario|trans_title= Without events, the end of the political campaign was stained by the tragedy in Rosario|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref>
President [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]], who had recently returned from a diplomatic visit to the [[United Nations]], visited the site of the explosion on August 7. She was berated by local residents;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608374-cristina-kirchner-llego-a-rosario-para-recorrer-la-zona-de-la-tragica-explosion|title= Cristina Kirchner visitó la zona de la explosión en Rosario y recibió insultos de los vecinos|trans_title= Cristina Kirchner visited the area of the explosion in Rosario and received insults from the neighbors|language= Spanish|author= Diego Yañez Martínez|date= August 7, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> some were angry because her surprise visit halted work at the site, and others thought her presence was politically motivated.<ref name="echada">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608637-insultos-y-abucheos-a-cristina-cuando-visito-el-lugar-de-la-tragedia|title= Insultos y abucheos a Cristina cuando visitó el lugar de la tragedia|trans_title= Insults and booings for Cristina when she visited the place of the tragedy|language= Spanish|author= Valeria Musse|date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> The president stayed briefly, visited the CEMAR and met Bonfatti.<ref name="echada" /> Kirchner's entourage was surrounded by members of [[La Cámpora]], who tried to prevent demonstrations against her and keep journalists and residents at bay.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608558-cruces-entre-militantes-de-la-campora-y-vecinos-por-la-llegada-de-cristina-kirchner-a-rosari|title= Cruces entre militantes de La Cámpora y vecinos por la llegada de Cristina Kirchner a Rosario|trans_title= Clash between militants of La Cámpora and neighbors for the arrival of Cristina Kirchner to Rosario|language= Spanish|author= Diego Yañez Martínez|date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref>
Weeks before the explosion, several [[social networking sites]] had scheduled a country-wide ''[[cacerolazo]]'' (a pot-banging protest demonstration), known as 8A, against Kirchner for August 8. The websites had already conducted successful ''cacerolazos'' ([[8N]] and [[18A]]). Despite the national mourning, the 8A protest went ahead as planned, with the added slogan "No more pointless deaths".<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608626-el-8-a-sigue-en-pie-con-la-consigna-no-mas-muertes-inutiles|title= El 8-A sigue en pie, con la consigna 'no más muertes inútiles'|trans_title= The 8-A still stands, with the slogan 'no more pointless deaths'|language= Spanish|author= Mariano Obarrio|date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> Candidate [[Ricardo Gil Lavedra]] thought the ''cacerolazo'' should have been canceled, as the campaigning was,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608671-ricardo-gil-lavedra-hoy-no-deberia-hacerse-la-protesta-del-8a|title= Ricardo Gil Lavedra: 'Hoy no debería hacerse la protesta del 8A'|trans_title= Ricardo Gil Lavedra: 'The 8A protest should not be made today'|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 23, 2013}}</ref> but fellow candidate [[Rodolfo Terragno]] supported it.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608833-rodolfo-terragno-y-ricardo-gil-lavedra-respaldaron-el-cacerolazo|title= Rodolfo Terragno y Ricardo Gil Lavedra respaldaron el cacerolazo|trans_title= Rodolfo Terragno and Ricardo Gil Lavedra supported the cacerolazo|language= Spanish|author= DyN|date= August 8, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref> It was attended by fewer people than previous ones in Buenos Aires and the rest of the country.<ref name="ochoa">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608973-con-una-protesta-menos-masiva-el-8-a-movilizo-a-los-caceroleros-mas-duros|title= Con una protesta menos masiva, el 8-A movilizó a los caceroleros más duros|trans_title= With a less massive protest, the 8-A movilized the strongest caceroleros|language= Spanish|author= Aurelio Tomás|date= August 9, 2013|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 1, 2013}}</ref> The demonstration in Rosario was not a ''cacerolazo'', but a silent [[candlelight vigil]] attended by nearly a hundred people.<ref name="ochoa" /> There was a second demonstration in Rosario on August 22, proceeding from the [[National Flag Memorial (Argentina)|National Flag Memorial]] to the headquarters of Litoral Gas.<ref>{{cite web |url= ==Reconstruction== Bonfatti announced that Santa Fe province would provide financial help to the victims of the explosion. Since most houses in the vicinity were damaged, affected families would receive a subsidy of $20,000 to rent homes during reconstruction. They would receive $50,000 in credit to buy furniture and appliances, payable in 60 months with five percent interest.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1608795-el-gobernador-de-santa-fe-antonio-bonfatti-anuncio-subsidios-el-estado-va-a-estar-presente|title= El gobernador de Santa Fe, Antonio Bonfatti, anunció subsidios: 'El http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1610254-arman-un-padron-de-viviendas-para-los-afectados-por-la-explosion-en-rosario#|title= Arman un padrón de viviendas para los afectados por la explosión en http://www.clarin.com/sociedad/Advierten-edificios-seguro-adecuado_0_971302942.html|title= Advierten que muchos edificios no tienen un seguro adecuado|trans_title= It is warned that many buildings may When the search for survivors ended, authorities closed Salta Street. Engineers began checking the buildings at [[ground zero]], trying to restore the original layout of the street and demolishing unstable structures.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1610242-rosario-tras-el-rescate-de-las-victimas-comienza-el-trabajo-de-reconstruccion-de-la-calle-sa|title= Rosario: tras el rescate de las víctimas, comienza el trabajo de
